title: Cohort Dynamics
text: illustrate, set model using three different setup functions.   value \(Z\) population size \(H=1000\), scaling function gives us annual EIR 2.
code: Sp <- makepar_F_sin() F_s <- make_function(Sp) Tp <- makepar_F_spline(tt=365*c(0:5), yy=c(1,1,1.6,.3,.7,1)) F_t <- make_function(Tp) tt = seq(0, 5*365, by = 10) plot(tt, F_s(tt), type ="l", ylab = "Seasonality, Trend", xlab = "Time (in Days)") lines(tt, F_t(tt), type ="l") opts = list(Z=2000/365, season_par = Sp, trend_par = Tp) mod_human <- xds_setup_human(HPop=1000, XHoptions = opts) mod_human <- xds_solve(mod_human, Tmax=5*365, dt=10) xds_plot_PR(mod_human) mod_eir <- xds_setup_eir(eir=2/365, season_par = Sp, trend_par = Tp) mod_eir <- xds_solve(mod_eir, Tmax=365*5, dt=10) xds_plot_PR(mod_eir)

title: Basic Mosquito Infection Dynamics in Discrete Time
text: define several variables describing adult female mosquitoes. Let \(M_t\) denote total density uninfected mosquitoes time \(t.\) assume mosquitoes emerge aquatic habitats rate \(\Lambda_t\) proportion mosquitoes, \(p\), survives day. total density mosquitoes described equation: \[M_{t+1} = \Lambda_t + p M_t\] let \(f\) denote proportion mosquitoes blood feeds day, let \(P_t\) denote density parous mosquitoes: \[P_{t+1} = f(M_t - P_t) + p P_t\] model infection process need two additional parameters: \(q\) - proportion blood meals taken humans \(\kappa_t\) - fraction human blood meals infect mosquito Let \(U\) denote density uninfected mosquitoes: \[U_{t+1} = \Lambda_t + p e^{-f q \kappa_t} U_t \] Let \(Y_{,t}\) denote density cohorts infected mosquitoes infected \(\) days ago: \[Y_{1, t+1} = p (1-e^{-f q \kappa_t}) U_t \] let \(\tau\) denote oldest cohort infected mosquitoes wish track. mosquitoes infected 1 day ago, let \(G_i\) fraction becomes infectious next day. modeled EIP fixed delay, \(G_i = 1\) \(< \tau\), \(G_\tau = 1\). Mosquitoes become infectious day \(\tau+1.\) \[Y_{+1, t+1} = p \left(1-G_i \right) Y_{, t} \] \[Y_{\tau, t+1} = p \left(1-G_{\tau-1} \right) Y_{\tau-1, t} + p \left(1-G_\tau \right) Y_{\tau, t}\] \(Z_t\) denote density infectious mosquitoes time \(t\) \[Z_{t+1} = \sum_i p G_i Y_i  + p Z_t\] defined variables, one necessary, since \[U = M- \sum_i Y_i - Z\]

title: Basic Mosquito Infection Dynamics in Discrete Time
text: model \(n\) patches, model defined , now let \(M_t,\) \(P_t,\) \(U_t\), \(Z_t\) vectors length \(p,\) let \(G\) vector length \(\tau,\) (\(G_1 = 0\)). let \(Y_t\) denote \(p \times \tau\) matrix, row cohort mosquitoes, column represents mosquitoes location. let \(Y_{,t}\) denote \(^{th}\) cohort: Now, also need define mosquito movement. let \(\sigma\) denote vector describing proportion mosquitoes emigrates patch, let \(\cal K\) denote matrix describing fraction emigrating mosquitoes end every patch, \[\mbox{diag}\; {\cal K} = 0.\] columns sum number less equal one, gap represents mortality occurring dispersal. let \(\Omega\) denote demographic matrix : \[\Omega = \mbox{diag}\left( p \left( 1-\sigma \right) \right) + \mbox{diag}\left( p \sigma \right) \cdot {\cal K} \] Now dynamics similar: \[ \begin{array}{rl} M_{t+1} &= \Lambda_t + \Omega \cdot M_t \\ P_{t+1} &= f (M_t - P_t) + \Omega \cdot P_t \\ \hline U_{t+1} &= \Lambda_t + \Omega \cdot \left(e^{-fq\kappa_t} U_t \right) \\ Y_{1, t+1} &= \Omega \cdot \left(\left(1-e^{-fq\kappa_t}\right)  U_t \right)  \\ Y_{+1, t+1} &= \Omega \cdot Y_{,t} \left(1-G_i   \right)  \\ Y_{\tau, t+1} &= \Omega \cdot \left( Y_{\tau-1, t}\;\left(1-G_{\tau-1} \right)  \right) + \Omega \cdot \left( Y_{\tau, t} \; \left(1-G_\tau \right) \right)  \\ Z_{t+1} &=  \Omega \cdot \left(Y_t \cdot \mbox{diag}(G) \right)+ \Omega \cdot Z_t \\ \end{array} \]

title: Basic Mosquito Infection Dynamics in Discrete Time
text: implementation, choose models EIP distributed period fraction maturing time \(\tau\) continuous. chosen rotating index track age infection cohorts matrix \(Y;\) using modulo arithmetic, columns tracks single cohort \(\tau\) days. \(\tau +1\) day, column added one , compute \(Y_{1,t}.\) computation thus : Noting modulo arithmetic, \(\tau+1 = 1\), get: \[ \begin{array}{rl} Y_{\tau, t+1} &= Y_{\tau, t+1} + Y_{\tau+1, t}    \\ Y_{1, t+1} &= \Omega \cdot \left(\left(1-e^{-fq\kappa_t}\right)  U_t \right)  \\ \end{array} \]

title: Basic Mosquito Infection Dynamics in Discrete Time
text: can verify model solving steady states. \[\bar M = \Lambda \cdot (1-\Omega)^{-1}\] \[\bar P = f \bar M \cdot (1-\Omega+ \mbox{diag}\;f )^{-1}\] \[\bar U = \Lambda \cdot (1-\Omega \cdot \mbox{diag}\; e^{-fq\kappa})^{-1}\] \[\bar Y_1 = \Omega \cdot \left( 1- e^{-fq\kappa}\right) \cdot \bar U\] \(1 < < \tau,\) get recursive relationship: \[\bar Y_{+1} = \Omega \cdot \; \bar Y_i (1-G_i) \] \(Y_{\tau},\) get: \[\bar Y_{\tau} = \Omega \cdot \left( \mbox{diag} \left(1-G\right) \right) \bar Y_{\tau-1} \cdot \left(1 - \Omega \left (1-G_\tau \right)  \right)^{-1}\] \[\bar Z = \Omega \cdot G \cdot Y \left( 1- \Omega\right)^{-1}\]

title: Basic Mosquito Infection Dynamics in Discrete Time
code: rm1 <- xds_setup(MYZname = "RM", Xname = "trivial", xds = 'dts') Om <- with(rm1$MYZpar[[1]], compute_Omega_dts(pp, ssigma, mmu, calK)) dts_solve(rm1, 200) -> rm1 #dts_steady(rm1) -> rm1 with(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]], {   plot(time, M, type = "l")    lines(time, U, col = "darkblue")    lines(time, Y, col = "purple")    lines(time, Z, col = "darkred")  }) xds_plot_YZ(rm1) compute_MYZ_equil = function(pars, Lambda, kappa, i=1){   with(pars$MYZpar[[i]],{      Mbar <-  Lambda/(1-p)      Pbar <- f*Mbar/(1 - p + f)     Ubar <- Lambda/(1-p*exp(-f*q*kappa))          Y1 <- Omega*(1-exp(-f*q*kappa))*Ubar      Yi = Y1     Y = Yi     for(i in 2:(max_eip-1)){       Yi <- Omega*Yi*(1-G[i])       Y = Y+Yi     }     Yn <- Omega*Yi     Y = Y + Yn     Zbar <- Omega*Yn/(1-p)      return(c(M = Mbar, P=Pbar, U=Ubar, Y=Y, Z= Zbar))  })} compute_MYZ_equil(rm1, 1000, .1) c( M = tail(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]]$M, 1),  P = tail(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]]$P, 1),  U = tail(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]]$U, 1), Y = tail(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]]$Y, 1), Z = tail(rm1$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]]$Z, 1) ) rm10 <- dts_setup(Xname = "trivial", nPatches = 10, membership = 1:10) rm10$Lpar[[1]]$scale = 1.5^c(1:10) dts_solve(rm10, 200) -> rm10 with(rm10$outputs$orbits$MYZ[[1]], {   plot(time, M[,10], type = "l")   for(i in 2:10)     lines(time, M[,i])  #  lines(time, U, col = "darkblue")  #  lines(time, Y, col = "purple")  #  lines(time, Z, col = "darkred")  })

title: Macdonald's Model
text: Macdonald’s model sporozoite rate, published 19521 played important role studies malaria. Later year, Macdonald introduced formula basic reproductive rate, now called \(R_0.\)2 Macdonald gives credit colleague Armitage mathematics. Armitage’s paper published next year,3 paper present model system differential equations. simple system differential equations consistent Macdonald’s model sporozoite rate three parameters one term: human blood feeding rate, \(\) extrinsic incubation period, \(\tau\) mosquito death rate, \(g\); probability surviving one day, \(p=e^{-g}\), \(g=-\ln p\) fraction bites humans infect mosquito, \(\kappa\) Let \(y\) denote fraction mosquitoes infected. dynamics given : \[\frac{dy}{dt} = \kappa (1-y) - g y\] Let \(z\) denote fraction mosquitoes infectious. model delay differential equation. Let \(y_\tau\) denote value \(y\) time \(t-\tau.\) parameters terms constant, :\[\frac{dz}{dt} = e^{-g\tau} \kappa (1-y_\tau) - g z\] model steady state fraction infected: \[\bar y = \frac{\kappa} {\kappa + g}\] fraction infectious, also called sporozoite rate, \[\bar z = \frac{\kappa} {\kappa + g}e^{-g\tau}.\] Macdonald used \(p\) formula : \[\bar z = \frac{\kappa} {\kappa -\ln p}e^{-p\tau}\] generate formula \(R_0,\) Macdonald introduces another variable three additional parameters: ratio mosquitoes humans, \(m\) rate infections clear, \(r\) fraction infectious bites infect human, \(b\) fraction infected infectious humans, \(x,\) given equation: \[\frac{dx}{dt} = m z (1-y) - r x\] model assumes \(\kappa = x.\) formula \(R_0\) system : \[R_0 = \frac{m b ^2}{gr} e^{-g\tau} = \frac{m b ^2}{(-\ln p)r} e^{-p\tau}\] form, model difficult use extend.

title: Macdonald's Model
text: mosquito module ramp.xds called macdonald based model first published 1982 Joan Aron Robert May4. includes state variables total mosquito density \(M\), infected mosquito density \(Y\), infectious mosquito density \(Z\). model, blood feeding rate split overall blood feeding rate, \(f\), human fraction, \(q\) \[=fq.\] Aron & May’s equations : \[\begin{array}{rl} \frac{dM}{dt} &= \Lambda(t) - g M \\ \frac{dY}{dt} &= fq\kappa(M-Y) - g Y \\ \frac{dZ}{dt} &= e^{-g\tau}fq\kappa_\tau(M_\tau-Y_\tau) - g Z \\ \end{array}\]

title: Macdonald's Model
text: module called macdonald extended beyond Aron & May formulation include spatial dynamics parity. formulate spatial model, spatial domain sub-divided set patches. Variable parameter names change, can now represent vectors length \(n_p.\) formulate demographic matrix, denoted \(\Omega,\) describes mosquito mortality, emigration, loss system. let \(\sigma\) denote emigration rate \(\cal K\) mosquito dispersal matrix. also introduce parameter, \(\mu\) model fraction mosquitoes lost emigration patch. \[\Omega = \mbox{diag} \left(g\right) + \left(\mbox{diag} \left(1-\mu\right)  - \cal K\right) \cdot \mbox{diag} \left(\sigma\right) \]

title: Macdonald's Model
text: \[\begin{array}{rl} \dot{M} & = \Lambda - \Omega\cdot M  \\ \dot{P} & = \mbox{diag}(f) \cdot (M-P) -  \Omega \cdot P\\ \dot{Y} & = \mbox{diag}(fq\kappa) \cdot (M-Y) - \Omega \cdot Y \\ \dot{Z} & = \dot{Z} = e^{-\Omega \tau} \cdot \mbox{diag}(fq\kappa_{t-\tau}) \cdot (M_{t-\tau}-Y_{t-\tau}) - \Omega \cdot Z \end{array} \]

title: Macdonald's Model
text: note module SI provides reasonably simple approximating model delay, computing \(fqZ,\) includes mortality dispersal occurred EIP: \[ Z = e^{-\Omega \tau} \cdot Y \] implementation SI similar spirit simple model presented Smith & McKenzie (2004)5. mortality dispersal EIP accounted , time lag . transient dynamics ODE model equal DDE model, equilibrium values, numerical work requiring finding equilibrium points, faster ODE model can safely substituted.

title: Macdonald's Model
text: two logical ways begin solving non-trivial equilibrium. first assumes \(\Lambda\) known, implies good knowledge mosquito ecology. second assumes \(Z\) known, implies knowledge biting rate human population. show .

title: Macdonald's Model
text: Given \(\Lambda\) can solve: \[ M = \Omega^{-1} \cdot \Lambda \] given \(M\) set \(\dot{Y}\) zero factor \(Y\) get: \[ Y = (\mbox{diag}(fq\kappa) + \Omega)^{-1} \cdot \mbox{diag}(fq\kappa) \cdot M \] set \(\dot{Z}\) zero get: \[ Z = \Omega^{-1} \cdot e^{-\Omega \tau} \cdot \mbox{diag}(fq\kappa) \cdot (M-Y) \] dynamics \(P\) independent infection dynamics, can solve given \(M\) : \[ P = (\Omega + \mbox{diag}(f))^{-1} \cdot \mbox{diag}(f) \cdot M \]

title: Macdonald's Model
text: common start estimate \(Z\), perhaps derived estimated EIR (entomological inoculation rate). Given \(Z\), can calculate state variables \(\Lambda\). numerical implementation, note \((e^{-\Omega\tau})^{-1} = e^{\Omega\tau}\). \[ M-Y = \mbox{diag}(1/fq\kappa) \cdot (e^{-\Omega\tau})^{-1} \cdot \Omega \cdot Z \] \[ Y = \Omega^{-1} \cdot \mbox{diag}(fq\kappa) \cdot (M-Y) \] \[ M = (M - Y) + Y \] \[ \Lambda = \Omega \cdot M \] can use equation \(P\) .

code: library(ramp.xds) library(expm) library(deSolve) library(data.table) library(ggplot2)

title: Macdonald's Model
text: \[ \begin{array}{rl} \frac{\textstyle{dy}}{\textstyle{dt}} & = \kappa \left(1 -y  \right) - g y \\ \frac{\textstyle{dz}}{\textstyle{dt}} & = e^{-g\tau} q \kappa_\tau \left[1 - y_\tau \right] - g z \end{array} \]

title: Macdonald's Model
text: set parameters simulation 3 patches. Now set parameter environment correct class using ramp.xds::make_parameters_MY_RM_xde, noting solving ode. Now set values \(\kappa\) \(\Lambda\) solve equilibrium values. use ramp.xds::make_inits_MY_RM_xde store initial values. equations implemented compute \(\Upsilon\) dynamically, attach Upsilon initial values: set indices ramp.xds::make_indices. can set initial conditions vector use deSolve::ode solve model. Normally values computed within ramp.xds::xDE_diffeqn. , set local version: output plotted . flat lines shown verification steady state solutions computed match steady states computed solving equations:
code: HPop = rep(1, 3) nPatches <- 3 f <- rep(0.3, nPatches) q <- rep(0.9, nPatches) g <- rep(1/20, nPatches) sigma <- rep(1/10, nPatches) mu <- rep(0, nPatches) eip <- 12 nu <- 1/2 eggsPerBatch <- 30 MYo = list(f=f,q=q,g=g,sigma=sigma,mu=mu,eip=eip,nu=nu,eggsPerBatch=eggsPerBatch) K_matrix <- matrix(0, nPatches, nPatches) K_matrix[1, 2:3] <- c(0.2, 0.8) K_matrix[2, c(1,3)] <- c(0.5, 0.5) K_matrix[3, 1:2] <- c(0.7, 0.3) K_matrix <- t(K_matrix)  Omega <- make_Omega_xde(g, sigma, mu, K_matrix) Upsilon <- expm::expm(-Omega * eip) kappa <- c(0.1, 0.075, 0.025) Xo = list(kappa=kappa) Lambda <- c(5, 10, 8) Lo = list(Lambda=Lambda) Omega_inv <- solve(Omega) M_eq <- as.vector(Omega_inv %*% Lambda) P_eq <- as.vector(solve(diag(f, nPatches) + Omega) %*% diag(f, nPatches) %*% M_eq) Y_eq <- as.vector(solve(diag(f*q*kappa) + Omega) %*% diag(f*q*kappa) %*% M_eq) Z_eq <- as.vector(Omega_inv %*% Upsilon %*% diag(f*q*kappa) %*% (M_eq - Y_eq)) MYo$M=M_eq MYo$P=P_eq MYo$Y=Y_eq MYo$Z=Z_eq params <- make_xds_object_template("dde", "mosy", nPatches, 1:3, 1:3) params <- setup_MY_obj("macdonald", params, 1, MYo)   params <- setup_MY_inits(params, 1, MYo) params <- setup_XH_obj("trivial", params, 1, Xo)  params <- setup_XH_inits(params, HPop, 1) params <- setup_L_obj("trivial", params, 1, Lo) params <- setup_L_inits(params, 1, Lo) params = make_indices(params) params <- change_K_matrix(K_matrix, params, 1) params$terms$Lambda[[1]] = Lambda params$terms$kappa[[1]] = kappa y0 = get_MY_inits(params, 1)  y0 = as.vector(unlist(y0)) params <- MBionomics(0,y0,params, 1)  dMYdt_local = func=function(t, y, pars) {   list(dMYdt(t, y, pars, 1)) }  out <- deSolve::dede(y = y0, times = 0:50, dMYdt_local, parms=params,                      method = 'lsoda')  out1 <- out out = out[, 1:13] colnames(out)[params$MY_obj$M_ix+1] <- paste0('M_', 1:params$nPatches) colnames(out)[params$MY_obj$P_ix+1] <- paste0('P_', 1:params$nPatches) colnames(out)[params$MY_obj$Y_ix+1] <- paste0('Y_', 1:params$nPatches) colnames(out)[params$MY_obj$Z_ix+1] <- paste0('Z_', 1:params$nPatches)  out <- as.data.table(out) out <- melt(out, id.vars = 'time') out[, c("Component", "Patch") := tstrsplit(variable, '_', fixed = TRUE)] out[, variable := NULL]  ggplot(data = out, mapping = aes(x = time, y = value, color = Patch)) +   geom_line() +   facet_wrap(. ~ Component, scales = 'free') +   theme_bw()

title: basicL
text: Given \(\Lambda\) egg laying rate adult mosquito population formulate solve dynamical model aquatic mosquitoes give emergence rate. However, example simply use trivial-based (forced) emergence model, \(\Lambda\) completely specifies aquatic mosquitoes. simplest model aquatic (immature) mosquito dynamics negative feedback (density dependence) : \[ \dot{L} = \eta - (\psi+\phi+\theta L)L \] equations allow number larval habitats \(l\) differ \(p\), general emergence rate given : \[ \Lambda = N \cdot \alpha \] \(N\) \(p\times l\) matrix \(\alpha\) length \(l\) column vector given : \[ \alpha = \psi L \]

title: basicL
text: general, know value \(\Lambda\) equilibrium can solve \(L\) directly using two equations. can consider \(\theta\), strength density dependence unknown solve : \[ \theta = (\eta - \psi L - \phi L) / L^2 \]

title: basicL
code: library(ramp.xds) library(deSolve) library(data.table) library(ggplot2)

title: basicL
text: run simple example 3 aquatic habitats equilibrium. use ramp.xds::make_parameters_L_basicL_xde set parameters. Please note runs aquatic mosquito component users read fully worked example run full simulation.
code: nHabitats <- 3 nPatches=nHabitats membership=1:nPatches params <- make_xds_object_template("ode", "aquatic", nPatches, membership) alpha <- c(10, 50, 20) eta <- c(250, 500, 170) psi <- 1/10 phi <- 1/12 L <- alpha/psi theta <- (eta - psi*L - phi*L)/(L^2) Lo = list(eta=eta, psi=psi, phi=phi, theta=theta, L=L) MYZo = list(MYZm <- eta) params$eggs_laid = eta  F_eta = function(t, pars){   pars$eggs_laid }  params = setup_L_obj("basicL", params, 1, Lo) params = setup_L_inits(params, 1, Lo) params = setup_MY_obj("trivial", params, 1, MYZo)  params = make_indices(params) xDE_aquatic = function(t, y, pars, F_eta) {   pars$terms$eta[[1]] <- F_eta(t, pars)   dL <- dLdt(t, y, pars, 1)   return(list(c(dL))) } y0 <- get_inits(params, flatten=TRUE)   out <- deSolve::ode(y = as.vector(unlist(y0)), times = seq(0,50,by=10), xDE_aquatic, parms = params, method = 'lsoda', F_eta = F_eta)  out1 <- out colnames(out)[params$L_obj[[1]]$ix$L_ix+1] <- paste0('L_', 1:params$nHabitats)  out <- as.data.table(out) out <- melt(out, id.vars = 'time') out[, c("Component", "Patch") := tstrsplit(variable, '_', fixed = TRUE)] out[, variable := NULL]  ggplot(data = out, mapping = aes(x = time, y = value, color = Patch)) +   geom_line() +   theme_bw()

title: basicL
text: function xds_setup_aquatic sets model includes aquatic dynamics, solved using xds_solve.aqua. setup functions simpler xds_setup come constrained choices. user can configure aquatic model (trivial wouldn’t make much sense), uses trivial force egg laying. configure aquatic model: Lo list parameter values attached. use MYZ model trivial configure egg laying.
code: Lo = list(   psi = 1/10,    phi = 1/12 ) alpha = c(10, 50, 20) Lo$L = with(Lo, alpha/psi)  Lo$theta = with(Lo, (eta - psi*L - phi*L)/(L^2)) Mo = list(MYZm = c(250, 500, 170)) xds_setup_aquatic(nHabitats=3, Lname = "basicL", Loptions = Lo, MYoptions = Mo) -> aqbasicL_xde xds_solve(aqbasicL_xde, Tmax=50, dt=10)$output$orbits$deout -> out2 sum(abs(out1-out2)) == 0 ## [1] TRUE

title: Emergence
text: First, set parameter values. Next, calculate equilibrium values following Ross-Macdonald vignette. use \(\mathcal{N}\) \(\mathcal{U}\) describe aquatic habitats dispersed amongst patches, mosquitoes patch disperse eggs habitat, respectively. Please note unequal numbers aquatic habitats patches, use MASS::ginv compute generalized inverse \(\mathcal{N}\) get \(\alpha\) required equilibrium. Now set model. Please see Ross-Macdonald vignette details adult model. use alpha Lambda parameter forced emergence model, ramp.xds::make_parameters_L_trivial. , running full transmission model, must use ramp.xds::MosquitoBehavior pass equilibrium values bionomic parameters ramp.xds::xDE_diffeqn_mosy.
code: nPatches <- 3 nHabitats <- 4 membership = c(1,2,3,3) HPop = 1000 calN <- matrix(0, nPatches, nHabitats) calN[1,1] <- 1 calN[2,2] <- 1 calN[3,3] <- 1 calN[3,4] <- 1  calU <- matrix(0, nHabitats, nPatches) calU[1,1] <- 1 calU[2,2] <- 1 calU[3:4,3] <- 0.5 f <- rep(0.3, nPatches) q <- rep(0.9, nPatches) g <- rep(1/20, nPatches) sigma <- rep(1/10, nPatches) mu <- rep(0, nPatches)  eip <- 11 nu <- 1/2 eggsPerBatch <- 30 MYo = list(   g=g, sigma=sigma, mu=mu, f=f, q=q, nu=nu, eggsPerBatch = eggsPerBatch ) K_matrix <- matrix(0, nPatches, nPatches) K_matrix[1, 2:3] <- c(0.2, 0.8) K_matrix[2, c(1,3)] <- c(0.5, 0.5) K_matrix[3, 1:2] <- c(0.7, 0.3) K_matrix <- t(K_matrix)  Omega <- make_Omega_xde(g, sigma, mu, K_matrix) Upsilon <- expm::expm(-Omega * eip)  kappa <- c(0.1, 0.075, 0.025) Lambda <- c(5, 10, 8) # equilibrium solutions Omega_inv <- solve(Omega)  M_eq <- as.vector(Omega_inv %*% Lambda) P_eq <- as.vector(solve(diag(f, nPatches) + Omega) %*% diag(f, nPatches) %*% M_eq)  # the "Lambda" for the dLdt model alpha <- as.vector(ginv(calN) %*% Lambda) xds_obj <- make_xds_object_template("ode", "mosy", nPatches, membership)  xds_obj = setup_L_obj("trivial", xds_obj, 1, options = list(Lambda=alpha))  xds_obj = setup_L_inits(xds_obj, 1)  xds_obj = setup_MY_obj("basicM", xds_obj, 1, options=MYo)  xds_obj = setup_MY_inits(xds_obj, 1, list(M=M_eq, P=P_eq)) xds_obj = setup_XH_obj("trivial", xds_obj, 1, list(HPop=HPop)) xds_obj = make_indices(xds_obj) xds_obj$terms$kappa = list() xds_obj$terms$kappa[[1]] = kappa xds_obj <- change_K_matrix(K_matrix, xds_obj) y0 <- get_inits(xds_obj) y0 #> $L #> list() #>  #> $MY #> $MY$M #> [1] 157.8680 123.4518 178.6802 #>  #> $MY$P #> [1] 140.35170  98.87622 155.05779 #>  #>  #> $X #> NULL out <- deSolve::ode(y = get_inits(xds_obj, flatten=TRUE), times = seq(0,50, by=10), func = xde_derivatives, parms = xds_obj, method = 'lsoda') out1 <- out colnames(out)[xds_obj$MY_obj[[1]]$ix$M_ix+1] <- paste0('M_', 1:xds_obj$nPatches) colnames(out)[xds_obj$MY_obj[[1]]$ix$P_ix+1] <- paste0('P_', 1:xds_obj$nPatches)  out <- as.data.table(out) out <- melt(out, id.vars = 'time') out[, c("Component", "Patch") := tstrsplit(variable, '_', fixed = TRUE)] out[, variable := NULL]  ggplot(data = out, mapping = aes(x = time, y = value, color = Patch)) +   geom_line() +   facet_wrap(. ~ Component, scales = 'free') +   theme_bw()

title: Emergence
code: Lo = list(   Lambda = alpha  ) MYo = list(   f = 0.3,   q = 0.9,   g = 1/20,   sigma = 1/10,   eip = 11,   nu = 1/2,   eggsPerBatch = 30,   M=M_eq,   P=P_eq ) xds_setup_mosy(MYname = "basicM", Lname = "trivial",                 nPatches = 3, membership = c(1,2,3,3),                 MYoptions = MYo, K_matrix = K_matrix, HPop=HPop, Loptions = Lo,                 kappa = c(0.1, 0.075, 0.025))->mosy1 xds_solve(mosy1,Tmax=50,dt=10)$outputs$deout -> out2 sum(abs(out2-out1)) #> [1] 0

code: MYZo = list(  g = 1/12, sigma = 1/12/2,  f = 1/3, q=0.9, nu=c(1/3,1/3,0),  eggsPerBatch = 30,   eip = 12,   M = 100,  P = 10,  Y = 1, Z = 0  ) Lo = list(  L = 1,    psi = 1/8, phi = 1/8,   theta = c(1/10, 1/20, 1/40, 1/100, 1/10)  ) Xo = list(  I = as.vector(0.2*HPop),  r = 1/200,  b = 0.55,  c = c(0.1, .02, .1, .02) ) xds_setup(MYname="macdonald", Xname="SIS", Lname="basicL",    nPatches = 3, HPop=c(10, 90, 100, 900),    membership=c(1,1,1,2,2),    MYoptions=MYZo, K_matrix=Kmatrix, XHoptions=Xo, Loptions = Lo,   residence=c(2,2,3,3), searchB=searchWtsH,    TimeSpent=TaR, searchQ = c(7,2,1,8,2)) -> mod534 mod534 <- xds_solve(mod534, Tmax=735, dt=15) mod534$outputs$orbits$deout -> out2 xds_plot_M(mod534, llty = c(1:3)) sum((tail(out2,1) - tail(out1, 1))^2) ## [1] 0 approx_equal(tail(out2, 1), tail(out1,1), tol = 1e-5) ## logical(0)

title: Hybrid MoI (Multiplicity of Infection) Human Model
text: equations follows: \[ \dot{m_{1}} = h - r_{1}m_{1} \] \[ \dot{m_{2}} = h - r_{2}m_{2} \] \(h = b EIR\), force infection. Prevalence can calculated MoI values : \[ x_{1} = 1-e^{-m_{1}} \] \[ x_{2} = 1-e^{-m_{2}} \] net infectious probability mosquitoes therefore given : \[ x = c_{2}x_{2} + c_{1}(x_{1}-x_{2}) \] \(c_{1}\) infectiousness inapparent infections, \(c_{2}\) infectiousness patent infections.

title: Hybrid MoI (Multiplicity of Infection) Human Model
text: One way proceed assume \(m_{2}\) known, models MoI patent (observable) infections. : \[ h = r_{2}/m_{2} \] \[ m_{1} = h/r_{1} \] can use calculate net infectious probability, \(\kappa = \beta^{\top} \cdot x\), allowing equilibrium solutions model feed components.

title: Hybrid MoI (Multiplicity of Infection) Human Model
text: run simple example 3 population strata equilibrium. use ramp.xds::make_parameters_X_hMoI_xde set parameters. Please note runs human population component users read fully worked example run full simulation. use null (constant) model human demography (\(H\) constant time). \(H\) appear equations , must specified model bloodfeeding (\(\beta\)) relies \(H\) compute consistent values.
code: library(ramp.xds) library(deSolve) library(viridisLite)

title: Hybrid MoI (Multiplicity of Infection) Human Model
text: , build model step--step.
code: nStrata <- 3 H <- c(100, 500, 250) residence = rep(1,3)  xds_obj <- make_xds_object_template("ode", "eir", 1, 1, residence) b <- 0.55 c1 <- 0.05 c2 <- 0.25 r1 <- 1/250 r2 <- 1/50 m2 <- rlnorm(3, .2, .5)  h <- r2*m2 m1 <- h/r1 Xo = list(b = b, c1 = c1, c2 = c2, r1 = r1, r2 = r2, m1=m1, m2=m2) eir <- h/b xds_obj = setup_XH_obj("hMoI", xds_obj, 1, Xo) xds_obj = setup_XH_inits(xds_obj, H, 1, Xo) xds_obj = setup_MY_obj("trivial", xds_obj, 1) xds_obj = setup_L_obj("trivial", xds_obj, 1) F_season = function(t){0*t+1} F_trend = function(t){0*t+1} xds_obj$EIR_obj = list()  xds_obj$EIR_obj$eir <- as.vector(eir) xds_obj$EIR_obj$scale <- 1  xds_obj$EIR_obj$F_season <- F_season xds_obj$EIR_obj$F_trend <- F_trend xds_obj$EIR_obj$F_age <- F_flat xds_obj$EIR_obj$season_par <- list()  xds_obj$EIR_obj$trend_par<- list()  xds_obj$EIR_obj$age_par<- list() xds_obj = make_indices(xds_obj) y0 <- get_inits(xds_obj) y0 #> $L #> list() #>  #> $MY #> NULL #>  #> $X #> $X$m1 #> [1] 3.032587 6.938575 1.805443 #>  #> $X$m2 #> [1] 0.6065175 1.3877150 0.3610886 xds_obj <- xds_solve(xds_obj)  XH <- xds_obj$outputs$orbits$XH[[1]] time <- xds_obj$outputs$time clrs = turbo(5) plot(time, XH$m1[,1], col = clrs[1], ylim = range(XH$m1), type = "l") lines(time, XH$m1[,2], col = clrs[2]) lines(time, XH$m1[,3], col =clrs[5])    lines(time, XH$m2[,1], col = clrs[1], lty = 2) lines(time, XH$m2[,2], col = clrs[2], lty=2) lines(time, XH$m2[,3], col =clrs[5], lty=2)

title: Hybrid MoI (Multiplicity of Infection) Human Model
code: xds_setup_eir(eir, Xname="hMoI", HPop=H, XHoptions = Xo) ->test_hMoI xds_solve(test_hMoI)-> test_hMoI  XH2 <- test_hMoI$outputs$orbits$XH[[1]] sum((XH$m1-XH2$m1)^2) #> [1] 0

title: SIS-xde (Susceptible-Infected-Susceptible) Human Model
text: subdivide population susceptible (\(S\)) infected infectious (\(\)) individuals, total population \(H = S+.\) assume force infection (\(h\), FoI) linearly proportional EIR: \(h = b \times EIR.\) general form, births (\(B(H)\)) deaths (per-capita rate \(\mu\)), generalized SIS_xde dynamics : \[ \begin{array}{rl} \dot{S} &= -h S + rI + B(H) -\mu S\\ \dot{} &= h S  - rI - \mu \end{array} \] demographic change, SIS-xde model can rewritten single equation: \[ \dot{} = h (H-) - rI \] Even simplified form, assuming population stratified, variables parameter vectors length nStrata.

title: SIS-xde (Susceptible-Infected-Susceptible) Human Model
text: typical situation using model \(H\) (total population size strata) \(X\) (number infectious persons strata) known census survey data. interest find value \(EIR\) (Entomological Inoculation Rate) leads prevalence equilibrium. \[ 0 = h \cdot (H-) - rI \] \[ \bar = H \frac{h}{h+r} \] \[ \bar S =  H - \bar \]

title: SIS-xde (Susceptible-Infected-Susceptible) Human Model
text: run simple example 3 population strata equilibrium. use ramp.xds::make_parameters_X_SIS_xde set parameters. Please note runs human population component users read fully worked example run full simulation. use null (constant) model human demography (\(H\) constant time).
code: library(ramp.xds) library(deSolve) library(viridisLite)

title: SIS-xde (Susceptible-Infected-Susceptible) Human Model
text: set systems differential equations, must set values parameters.
code: nStrata <- 3 H <- c(100, 500, 250) residence <- rep(1,3)  nPatches=1 nHabitats=1 membership=1 params <- make_xds_object_template("ode", "eir", nPatches, membership, residence) b <- rep(0.55, nStrata)  c <- rep(0.15, nStrata)  r <- rep(1/200, nStrata)  Xo = list(b=b, c=c, r=r) params <- setup_XH_obj("SIS", params, 1, Xo) params <- setup_XH_inits(params, H, 1, Xo) foi = c(1:3)/365  eir <- foi/b  steady_state_X(foi, H, params)-> ss ss ## $S ## [1]  64.60177 238.56209  94.55959 ##  ## $I ## [1]  35.39823 261.43791 155.44041 MYo = list(MYm = eir*H) Xo$S=ss$S Xo$I=ss$I params <- setup_MY_obj("trivial", params, 1) params <- setup_L_obj("trivial", params, 1) params <- setup_L_inits(params, 1) params <- make_indices(params) F_s = function(t){0*t+1} F_t= function(t){0*t+1} F_a = function(a){0*a+1} params$EIR_obj = list()  params$EIR_obj$eir <- as.vector(eir) params$EIR_obj$scale <- 1  params$EIR_obj$F_season <- F_s params$EIR_obj$F_trend <- F_t params$EIR_obj$F_age <- F_a params = make_indices(params) Xo$S=H  Xo$I=H*0 params = setup_XH_inits(params, H, 1, options = Xo) y0 <- get_inits(params) y0$X ## $H ## [1] 100 500 250 ##  ## $I ## [1] 0 0 0 params <- xds_solve(params) clrs = turbo(5) XH <- get_XH_out(params, 1)  with(XH,{   plot(time, true_pr[,1], col = clrs[1], ylim = c(0,1), type = "l")   lines(time, true_pr[,2], col = clrs[2])   lines(time, true_pr[,3], col =clrs[5]) })

title: Modular Forms for Disease Dynamics
text: mathematical framework building modular models malaria dynamics control (mosquito-borne pathogens) described Spatial Dynamics Malaria Transmission, framework implemented ramp.xds. standard form writing systems differential equations, many forms used, depending context. comparison, writing system equations emphasize modularity, modular form. illustrate modular form, start Ross-Macdonald-style model Box 1. Box 1: Ross-Macdonald Model Let dependent variable \((t)\) denote density infected humans, parameter \(H\) density humans Let dependent variable \(Y(t)\) denote density infected mosquitoes, parameter \(M\) density mosquitoes Let \(b\) denote fraction bites infective mosquitoes infect human, let \(r\) denote rate infections clear Let \(c\) denote fraction blood meals infectious humans infect mosquito, let \(g\) denote mosquito death rate Let \(f\) denote overall blood feeding rate, \(q\) human fraction Let \(\tau\) denote EIP. set equations, ignore delay sporogony, count mortality, infections occur rate \(b e^{-g \tau} fqY/H.\) assume daily FoI linearly proportional daily EIR, consistent Poisson model exposure, \(h = .\) \[ \begin{array}{rl} dI/dt &= b e^{-gn}fq \frac YH (H-) - r \\ dY/dt &= fq c \frac IH (M-Y) - g Y \end{array}\]

title: Modular Forms for Disease Dynamics
text: illustrate writing Ross-Macdonald model modular form (Figure 1). modular form, identify terms one equation depend variable. First, focus equation describing human infection dynamics. note depends term involving variable \(Y.\) term epidemiologically meaningful – called force infection (FoI). let \(h\) denote FoI: \[h=b e^{-gn}fq \frac YH,\] now can rewrite equation \[ dI/dt = h  (H-) - r \] Next, isolate equation describing mosquito infection dynamics, note depends term call net infectiousness (NI). \[\kappa = \frac XH\] term \[ X = c \] density infected humans, weighted infectiousness. note \(fq\kappa\) FoI mosquito infections, now can rewrite equation mosquitoes: \[ dY/dt = fq\kappa (M-Y) - g Y \] Since also want make model extensible, want draw attention term \(h.\) note number infective bites, per human, per day – called daily entomological inoculation rate (EIR) – \[E = f q e^{-g\tau} \frac YH \] assume exposure Poisson distributed: \[h = b E\] emphasize set

title: Modular Forms for Disease Dynamics
text: solve equations, need write functions compute derivatives. using R package deSolve. properly formed derivative function implementing
code: RMv1 <- function(t, y, pars) {   with(pars,{       eir = exp(-g*n)*Y/H       foi = b*eir       kappa = c*I/H       dX = foi*(H-I) - r*I       dY = a*kappa*(M-Y) - g*Y        return(list(dX, dY))   }) }

title: Nimble Model Building
text: Dynamical systems models malaria mosquito-borne pathogens (MBPs) naturally modular. Transmission dynamics involve infection dynamics populations two different species hosts: mosquito host, human vertebrate animal host. Parasite / pathogen transmission occurs blood feeding. modular nature systems can emphasized rewriting equations using modular forms Mosquito population density parameter Ross-Macdonald model. Many dynamical systems describing transmission dynamics control malaria MBPs include equations describing mosquito ecology population dynamics: volant adult aquatic immature mosquito sub-populations connected egg-laying emergence. equations describing dynamics can organized around blood feeding (transmission) egg-laying emergence (mosquito ecology). simple models, assumptions Dynamical systems malaria MBPs broad set features: spatial dynamics; human/host demography; heterogeneous transmission; various forms vector control; health interventions; mosquito resource dynamics; malaria importation; exogenous forcing weather. ramp.xds, equations solved computing terms derivatives separately. Transmission(t,y,pars) computes three terms required compute parasite transmission blood feeding. stored main model object pars: pars$beta - function allocates infective bites human strata. case, \(\beta = 1/H\) pars$NI - function \(F_X\) computes effective density. case, \(F_X\) returns \(cI\) pars$fqZ - function \(F_fqZ\) computes infective biting density pars$EIR - daily EIR \(\beta \cdot fqZ\) pars$FoI - daily FoI \(F_h(EIR, b, pars\)Xpar)$ Exposure(t, y, pars) computes FoI EIR model exposure stores pars$FoI instead developing models like RMv1, implemented code syle RMv2:
code: RMv2 <- function(t, y, pars) {   with(pars,{       pars = Transmission(t, y, pars)       pars = Exposure(t, y, pars)       dX = dXdt(t, y, pars)        dY = dMYZdt(t, y, pars)        return(list(dX, dY))   }) }

title: Nimble Model Building
text: Models mosquito borne pathogen transmission systems naturally modular, structured vector life stage, host population strata, spatial locations (patches) transmission occurs (see figure ). > Models ramp.xds framework constructed 3 dynamical components: \(\mathcal M\): adult mosquitoes, whose dynamics described \(d\mathcal{M}/dt\) \(\mathcal{L}\): aquatic (immature) mosquitoes, whose dynamics described \(d\mathcal{L}/dt\) \(\mathcal{X}\): human population, whose dynamics described \(d\mathcal{X}/dt\) combined state 3 components entire state dynamical model, combined dynamics described differential equations represents full endogenous dynamics system. addition 2 components directly contribute state model, instead modify parameters compute intermediate quantities represent external influences system. : Exogenous forcing: weather, climate, unmodeled populations Vector control: public health mosquito control interventions affect dynamical components also functions handle exchange information (flows) dynamical components couple dynamics. Bloodfeeding process adult mosquitoes seek feed blood hosts, results quantities \(EIR\) (entomological inoculation rate) \(\kappa\), net infectiousness humans mosquitoes, couple dynamics \(\mathcal{M}\) \(\mathcal{X}\). Likewise emergence new adults aquatic habitats egg laying adults habitats couples \(\mathcal{M}\) \(\mathcal{L}\). function ramp.xds::xde_derivatives compute necessary quantities returns vector derivatives state variables can used solve trajectories model ramp.xds. program flow within function summarized diagram:  information, please read research article describing theory behind model.

what: Compute Derivatives for L module basicL — dLdt.basicL
title: Compute Derivatives for L module basicL — dLdt.basicL
text: implements differential equation model aquatic mosquito ecology. equations modified slightly version published Smith DL, et al. (2013). Variables: \(L\): density mosquito larvae habitat Input Term: \(\eta\) eta: egg deposition rate (F_eggs) Parameters: \(\psi\) psi: maturation rate \(\xi\) xi: delayed maturation parameter response mean crowding \(\phi\) phi: density-independent death rate \(\theta\) theta: slope mortality rate response mean crowding Dynamical System: $$dL/dt = \eta - (\psi\;e^{-\xi L} + \phi + \theta L)L$$ Output Term: function F_emerge computes net emergence rate (\(\alpha\)): $$\alpha = \psi e^{-\xi L} L $$ Regulation: model, population regulated two ways. First, per-capita mortality increases mean crowding; per-capita mortality \(\phi + \theta L.\) Second, maturation delayed response mean crowding \(\psi\;e^{-\xi L.}\) Depending values \(\xi,\) productivity habitats might monotonically increasing function egg laying. model Smith DL, et al. (2013) include delayed maturation; model recovered setting \(\xi=0.\)

title: Compute Derivatives for L module basicL — dLdt.basicL
text: Smith DL, Perkins TA, Tusting LS, Scott TW, Lindsay SW (2013). “Mosquito population regulation larval source management heterogeneous environments.” PLoS ONE, 8(8), e71247. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0071247 .

what: Compute Derivatives for MY module SI — dMYdt.SI
title: Compute Derivatives for MY module SI — dMYdt.SI
text: SI model mosquito infection dynamics defined variable classes: \(M\) density mosquitoes patch; \(Y\) density infected mosquitoes patch. density infectious mosquitoes patch given term (returned F_fqZ.SI): $$Z = e^{-\Omega \tau} \cdot Y$$ model blood feeding parameters : \(f\) overall blood feeding rate \(q\) human fraction blood feeding parameters describing egg laying (see F_eggs.SI) : \(\nu\) egg laying rate \(\xi\) number eggs per batch model demographic parameters : \(g\) mortality rate \(\sigma\) emigration rate \(\mu\) emigration loss rate \(K\) mosquito dispersal matrix four parameters describing mortality migration used construct demographic matrix: $$\Omega = \mbox{diag}\left(g\right) - \left(\mbox{diag}\left(1-\mu\right) -  K \right) \cdot \mbox{diag}\left(\sigma\right)$$ emergence rate adult mosquitoes, \(\Lambda\), computed F_emerge, derivatives given equations: $$ \begin{array}{rr} dM/dt = & \Lambda - \Omega \cdot M \\ dY/dt = & f q \kappa (M-Y) - \Omega \cdot Y \end{array}. $$

what: Compute derivatives for the MY module macdonald — dMYdt.macdonald
title: Compute derivatives for the MY module macdonald — dMYdt.macdonald
text: implements delay differential equation model adult mosquito ecology infection dynamics consistent model published George Macdonald 1952. generalized version model, module GeRM, developed handle exogenous forcing weather vector control. model used educational purposes. Variables: \(M\): density adult mosquitoes \(Y\): density infected adult mosquitoes \(Z\): density infectious adult mosquitoes Parameters Terms: \(\Lambda\) Lambda: emergence rate adult mosquitoes (F_emerge) \(f\) f: blood feeding rate \(q\) q: maturation rate \(\tau\) eip: extrinsic incubation period \(\Omega\) Omega: adult mosquito demographic matrix, including mortality migration \(\Upsilon\) Upsilon: survival dispersal eip, \(\Upsilon= e^{-\Omega \tau}\) Dynamics: delay equation, use subscript denote lagged value variable term: e.g., \(M_\tau = M(t-\tau)\). $$ \begin{array}{rl} dM/dt &= \Lambda - \Omega \cdot M \\ dY/dt &= fq\kappa(M-Y) - \Omega \cdot Y \\ dZ/dt &= \Upsilon \cdot (fq\kappa)_\tau(M_\tau-Y_\tau) - \Omega \cdot Y \\ \end{array}$$ model included mainly historical interest. updated handle exogenous forcing weather vector control module GeRM

what: Derivatives function for the SIS model (XH* Model) — dXHdt.SIS
title: Derivatives function for the SIS model (XH* Model) — dXHdt.SIS
text: Compute derivatives SIS compartmental model: \(S\) density susceptible humans (hosts) \(\) density infected humans (hosts) \(H=S+\)  human (host) population density clearance rate infections \(r\), assumption, individuals assumed susceptible infection clearing infections. model port model mass treatment, equations \(\xi(t)\). xds implementation computes \(dH/dt\) rather \(dS/dt.\) functions get_XH_vars parse_XH_orbits, \(S\) computed \(S=H-\) listed variable. derivatives computed : $$ \begin{array}{rl} dH/dt = & B(t,H)  + D \cdot H \\ dI/dt = & h (H-) - r - \xi(t) +  D \cdot \end{array} $$ \(S=H-\); \(\xi(t)\) function simulate mass treatment; \(B(t, H)\) time-dependent birth rate; \(D\) linear operator, matrix describing demographic changes, including mortality, migration, aging;

title: Compute the Laying Matrix — make_O_matrix
text: algorithm motivated notion mosquito searching aquatic habitat quantity call habitat availability, \(Q\). habitat assigned search weight, \(\omega\). simplest case, habitat availability sum \(\omega\) patch, uses habitat membership matrix, \(N\). habitats model got eggs, $$Q = N \cdot \omega.$$ fraction eggs \(j^{th}\) patch laid \(^{th}\) habitat \(\omega_i / Q_j.\) make model extensible, habitat availability sums places mosquitoes might lay eggs, including ovitraps unsuitable habitats. every element \(Q\) positive, egg distribution matrix  : $${O} = \mbox{diag}\left(\omega \right) \cdot {N}^T \cdot \mbox{diag} \left(\frac{1}{Q}\right).$$ avoid dividing zero, zero elements \(Q\) set arbitrary positive value.

title: Make an xds model object template — make_xds_object_template
text: xds used dispatch various functions set solve systems differential equations. 'xde' ordinary delay differential equations; 'dts' "discrete time systems" frame model component subset nPatches number patches membership habitat membership vector residency strata residency vector

title: Make an xds model object template — make_xds_object_template
text: xds model object

title: Make an xds model object template — make_xds_object_template
text: function sets interfaces core objects used ramp.xds. First, function sets short text strings (assigned S3 class) dispatch various cases various S3 functions: xds either "xde"  differential equations, "dts" discrete time systems xde either "ode"  ordinary differential equations; "dde" delay differential equations; "dts" discrete time systems frame one several cases: "full" includes three dynamical components: human/host dynamical component, \(\cal XH\); adult mosquito dynamical component, \(\cal MYZ\); aquatic mosquito dynamical component, \(\cal L\). form (possibly trivial case) (see xds_setup()) "mozy" mosquito ecology models (see xds_setup_mosy()), including models without pathogen infection dynamics mosquitoes "aquatic" aquatic mosquito ecology models (see xds_setup_aquatic()), forced function describing egg laying "human" human/host infection dynamics(see xds_setup_human()), forced infective density adult mosquitoes, \(fqZ\) "eir" human/host cohort infection dynamics (see xds_setup_eir()), forced function F_eir forcing set "static" Second, function sets values structural parameters: nPatches \(N_p\) number patches nHabitats \(N_q\), number aquatic habitats, set length(membership) nStrata \(N_h\), number human/ host population strata, set length(HPop) nVectorSpecies \(N_s\), number vector species set 1; nHostSpecies \(N_i\), number host species set 1; Next, function sets empty lists hold model objects define components: XH_obj  Transmission  calls setup_transmission() model availability visitors; default, visitors Next, function sets egg laying, blood feeding, transmission: Egg Laying calls make_habitat_matrix(), setup_ML_interface() Blood Feeding calls make_residency_matrix(), setup_XY_interface() Transmission  calls setup_transmission() sets static model availability visitors; default, visitors Finally, function sets miscellaneous options: Exposure called Transmission compute environmentally heterogeneous exposure malaria importation travel: setup_exposure sets Poisson model environmental heterogeneity setup_travel_object sets model exposure travel

text: xds stands extensible differential equation

title: Setup the Habitat Interface for Egg Laying and Emergence — setup_ML_interface
text: implements model egg laying described Wu SL, et al., (2023). Modular computation ramp.xds requires rigid interface guarantee mathematical consistency egg laying emergence. interface defined object called ML_interface attached xds object xds_obj xds_obj$ML_interface. interface includes habitat membership matrix, \(N\) made make_habitat_matrix habitat search weights quantity motivated mosquito searching resources, called habitat availability \(Q\), computed F_Q; availability ovitraps availability unsuitable habitats availability anything attracts egg laying mosquitoes, including ovitraps unsuitable habitats egg distribution matrix \(O\), made make_O_matrix vector stores eggs laid function called compute_xds_object_template set ML_interface variables parameters variables might depend .

title: Setup the Habitat Interface for Egg Laying and Emergence — setup_ML_interface
text: Wu SL, Henry JM, Citron DT, Ssebuliba DM, Nsumba JN, C HMS, Brady OJ, Guerra CA, García GA, Carter AR, Ferguson HM, Afolabi , Hay SI, Jr RCR, Kiware S, Smith DL (2023). “Spatial dynamics malaria transmission.” PLoS Computational Biology, 19(6), e1010684. doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010684 , 2023-06-27.

title: Setup the Blood Feeding Interface — setup_XY_interface

title: Setup the Blood Feeding Interface — setup_XY_interface
text: implements framework model blood feeding described Wu SL, et al., (2023). Modular computation ramp.xds requires rigid interface guarantee mathematical consistency computing quantites related blood feeding transmission. interface blood feeding defined object called XY_interface, attached xds model object xds_obj$XY_interface. blood feeding interface sets several objects: residency matrix \(J\) (see make_residency_matrix) time spent (TiSp) matrix \(\Theta\) (see setup_TimeSpent) circadian function F_circadian vector species time risk (TaR) matrix \(\Psi,\) product TiSp matrix circadian function blood feeding search weights \(\omega\) vector describing available humans (hosts), \(W\) (see F_W_available) vector describing available visitors, \(V\) vector describing available blood hosts, \(O\) vector describing total available blood hosts, \(B\) (see F_B_available) quantities used compute transmission matrix, \(\beta\), models transmission (see setup_transmission()). Mosquito bionomic parameters constrained. bionomic parameters assigned, guarantee internally mathematically consistent sensible. guarantee internal consistency, concept resource available used compute blood feeding rates (\(f\)) using functional responses. human fraction \(q=W/B\). available can also used model mosquito movement. Mulit-Host Models models multiple host species, let \(W_i\) denote available \(^{th}\) host species. Total availablity blood hosts $$B = \sum_i W_i + O + V,$$ fraction bites host species \(W_i/B\). models multiple vector species one host species, vector species different search habits preferences. blood feeding available computed species, denoted \(B_s\) \(W_{s}\). models multiple vector multiple host species, \(W_{,s}\) available \(^{th}\) host species \(s^{th}\) vector species. hosts, available based time spent patch, time risk, time spent time day weighted mosquito species-specific search weights reflecting different preferences circadian function describing relative mosquito blood feeding rates time day.

title: Setup the Blood Feeding Interface — setup_XY_interface
text: Wu SL, Henry JM, Citron DT, Ssebuliba DM, Nsumba JN, C HMS, Brady OJ, Guerra CA, García GA, Carter AR, Ferguson HM, Afolabi , Hay SI, Jr RCR, Kiware S, Smith DL (2023). “Spatial dynamics malaria transmission.” PLoS Computational Biology, 19(6), e1010684. doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010684 , 2023-06-27.

what: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
text: Make xds model object: Define dynamical components: XH - Component modules human / host infection dynamics class Xname trivial demographics - Component modules adult mosquito ecology infection dynamics class MYname L Component modules aquatic mosquito ecology class Lname Define basic structural parameters single host vector population: \(n_p\) nPatches - number patches \(n_q\) nHabitats = length(membership) - numer locations aquatic habitats \(n_h\) nStrata = length(residence) - number human / host population strata basic demographic information Configure basic elements Search weights human population strata Search weights aquatic habitats mosquito dispersal matrix, \(K\) time spent matrix \(\Theta\) Advanced options can configured basic setup.

title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
code: xds_setup(   xds = "ode",   Xname = "SIS",   XHoptions = list(),   MYname = "macdonald",   MYoptions = list(),   Lname = "trivial",   Loptions = list(),   nPatches = 1,   HPop = 1000,   residence = 1,   membership = 1,   searchB = 1,   TimeSpent = list(),   K_matrix = list(),   searchQ = 1,   BFopts = list(),   model_name = "unnamed" )

title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
text: xds ode dde dts ordinary delay differential difference equations Xname character string defining X Component module XHoptions list configure X Component module MYname character string defining module MYoptions options set component Lname character string defining L Component module Loptions list configure L Component module nPatches number patches HPop number humans patch residence vector describes patch human stratum lives membership vector describes patch aquatic habitat found searchB vector search weights blood feeding TimeSpent either TimeSpent matrix string call function sets K_matrix either K_matrix matrix string defines set searchQ vector search weights egg laying BFopts list configure blood feeding model model_name name model (arbitrary)

title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
text: xds object

title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
text: Using basic structural parameters, basic template created make_xds_object_template properly configured interface blood feeding egg laying, xds_obj$frame = class(xds_obj$frame) = 'full' . nPatches passed parameter nHabitats configured passing habitat membership vector, nHabitats = length(membership) nStrata configured passing vector human population densities residence vector, nStrata = length(residence) = length(HPop) nHostSpecies=1 (basic setup handles first host species) nVectorSpecies=1 (basic setup handles first vector species) . 2. one dynamical components configured. xds_obj$XH_obj[[1]] defines model human / host infection dynamics class Xname (X component). parameter values passed named list, XHoptions. xds_obj$MY_obj[[1]] defines model adult mosquito ecology & infection dynamics class MYname (Component). parameter values passed named list, MYoptions. xds_obj$L_obj[[1]] defines model aquatic mosquito ecology class Lname (L Component). parameter values passed named list, Loptions. configuring dynamical components, several structural parameters can configured command line: Habitat search weights can set Host population search weights can set mosquito dispersal matrix, \(\cal K\), can set time spent matrix, \(\Theta\), can set Advanced features must configured later, including: multiple-host species multiple-vector species exogenous forcing weather, resources, factors vector control, vaccines, mass

title: Build a Model and Configure All Components — xds_setup
text: Component trivial module, consider using xds_setup_aquatic xds_setup_human xds_setup_eir. Models mosquito ecology need include states describing infection status (see xds_setup_mosy).

title: Build a Model for a single Human / Host Epidemiology forced by the EIR — xds_setup_eir

text: eir entomological inoculation rate season_par parameters configure seasonality function using make_function F_season function describing seasonal pattern time trend_par parameters configure trends function using make_function F_trend function describing temporal trend time age_par parameters configure age weights function using make_function F_age assigning biting weight age xds ode dde dts ordinary delay differential difference equations Xname character string specifying X Component module XHoptions list configure X Component module HPop number humans stratum searchB vector search weights blood feeding model_name name model (arbitrary)

what: Build a Model of Human / Host Epidemiology — xds_setup_human
title: Build a Model of Human / Host Epidemiology — xds_setup_human
text: modified version xds_setup streamlines setup models trival Component. xds object defines frame = class(frame) = 'human' dispatch xde_derivatives.human dts_update.human associated functions. Component module set trivial. funcion F_fqZ.trivial called compute passes density infectious adult mosquitoes, \(f\) \(q\) can still configured. case, daily EIR computed using blood feeding interface, including Exposure, way model non-trivial Component module. study human cohort dynamics passing function computes daily EIR, consider using xds_setup_eir.

title: Build a Model of Human / Host Epidemiology — xds_setup_human
code: xds_setup_human(   Xname = "SIS",   XHoptions = list(),   xds = "ode",   nPatches = 1,   residence = 1,   HPop = 1000,   searchB = 1,   TimeSpent = list(),   MYoptions = list(),   BFopts = list(),   model_name = "unnamed" )

what: Build a Model of Mosquito Ecology — xds_setup_mosy
title: Build a Model of Mosquito Ecology — xds_setup_mosy
text: modified version xds_setup streamlines setup models without parasite / pathogen infection dynamics. models lack Y component X component, often need H component (host density). xds object defines frame = class(frame) = 'mosy' dispatch xde_derivatives.mosy dts_update.mosy associated functions. X Component module trivial, since humans / vertebrate hosts can resource, HPop must set.

title: Build a Model of Mosquito Ecology — xds_setup_mosy
code: xds_setup_mosy(   xds = "ode",   MYname = "basicM",   Lname = "basicL",   nPatches = 1,   membership = 1,   HPop = 1000,   K_matrix = list(),   searchQ = 1,   kappa = 0,   MYoptions = list(),   Loptions = list(),   model_name = "unnamed" )

title: Build a Model of Mosquito Ecology — xds_setup_mosy
text: xds ode dde dts ordinary delay differential difference equations MYname character string defining Component module Lname character string defining L Component module nPatches number patches membership vector describes patch aquatic habitat found HPop human / host population density K_matrix either K_matrix matrix string defines set searchQ vector search weights egg laying kappa vector describing net infectiousness MYoptions list configure Component module Loptions list configure L Component module model_name name model (arbitrary)
